title: OCE Charity stream success story <3

embed.description: Spidicus goes super saiyan in his efforts to raise money for Save The Children. https://www.savethechildren.org.au/donate/make-a-donation?gclid=CLynpuy2_dACFYJjvAodDDcM6A Quality OCE Gameplay and over $100 raised for charity - thanks to all the viewers twitch.tv/spididcus

body:
I'm not a streamer, I just set it up because I've got NBN and an amazing PC. I have a very small community of regular viewers, and I decided to do something special for christmas, thinking over a couple of weeks I might if I'm lucky be able to raise $50 for charity.

This is a compilation of one nights stream. I wanted to share because people always say OCE community are toxic/trolls and while it very well may be the case, there are also some amazing people that donated to 'Save the Children' this weekend. Thank you all so much. In one night we raise $114.50.

I will continue to stream will all donations (if any) going to charity because its fun. If you want entertainment come drop by and say hi, if you want high quality gameplay PM me and I'm sure I can refer you to some amazingly skilled streamers.

Inb4 shameless self plug - twitch.tv/spidicus

Cheers
Spidicus

replies.body:
Thanks man. I appreciate it. Also if you watched the video, ty for not banning me for toxicity. If you didn't watch the video, then dw about what I said I'm a super nice guy all the time <3

Cheers!

While I normally question the reliability of charity organisations myself, but I don't have much to oppose people's intention to use them.

I will just wish you good luck.
It looks like he has already done it and it was a success.
